```md
## Summary

A concise overview of the proposed feature.

## Purpose and Rationale

What is the driving force behind this proposal? Which use cases does it address? What do we hope to achieve?

## Considered Alternatives

Discuss other designs that were considered and compare their advantages and disadvantages with this proposal.

## Introduction of New Terms

Detail any new terminology that comes with this proposal.

## In-Depth Design

Describe the feature as though it's already implemented and you are educating another SHDW core contributor. This typically involves:

- Describing the proposed modification and its mechanism
- The integration of the feature into the core or relevant subsystem
- Possible approaches for implementing this feature
- How it interacts with other features
- Handling of special scenarios or edge cases

The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD",
"SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this
document are to be interpreted as described in [RFC
2119](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2119.txt) and [RFC
8174](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc8174.txt).

## Effects and Implications

Examine the effects of this proposal on developers, node operators, and core contributors.

## Security Aspects

What are the security considerations associated with this feature? Include any specific implementation advice or potential risks.

## Potential Downsides *(Optional)*

What are the reasons to avoid this proposal?

## Compatibility and Breakage *(Optional)*

Will this feature lead to any compatibility issues? List all potential incompatibilities and their effects.
```
